name: Operational Amplifier Gain
explanation: Operational amplifiers (op-amps) are high-gain differential amplifiers, fundamental building blocks of analog electronics. In inverting configuration, gain is -R_f/R_in (negative means signal inversion). In non-inverting configuration, gain is 1 + R_f/R_in. Op-amps are used in amplifiers, filters, comparators, oscillators, and mathematical operations (addition, integration, differentiation). They're versatile, precise, and essential for signal processing.

examples.problem: An inverting op-amp has R_in = 1kΩ and R_f = 10kΩ. What is the gain?
A non-inverting op-amp needs gain of 5. If R_in = 2kΩ, what is R_f?
